alert.note: Alert for Beaver; Cimarron; Texas (Oklahoma) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Fire Weather Watch issued February 20 at 9:53PM CST until February 23 at 12:00AM CST by NWS Amarillo
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM NOON TO 7 PM CST TUESDAY FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR CENTRAL AND WESTERN PARTS OF THE COMBINED PANHANDLES... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY EVENING FOR STRONG WINDS AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE ENTIRE COMBINED PANHANDLES... * Affected Area...In Oklahoma...Cimarron...Texas and Beaver. In Texas...Dallam...Sherman...Hansford...Ochiltree...Lipscomb... Hartley...Moore...Hutchinson...Roberts...Hemphill...Oldham... Potter...Carson...Gray...Wheeler...Deaf Smith...Randall... Armstrong...Donley...Collingsworth and Palo Duro Canyon. * 20 Foot Winds...For Tuesday...Southwest 25 to 35 mph with gusts up to 55 mph. For Wednesday...Southwest winds 30 to 40 mph with gusts up to 65 mph. * Relative Humidity...For Tuesday...As low as 12 percent. For Wednesday...As low as 18 percent. * Red Flag Threat Index...For Tuesday...4 to 6. For Wednesday 3 to 4. * Timing...Warning is from 12 PM CST through 7 PM CST Tuesday. Watch is from 12PM CST Wednesday through midnight Wednesday night.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now...or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures will create favorable weather for rapid fire growth and spread. Avoid activities that promote open flames and sparks. A Fire Weather Watch means that the potential for critical fire weather conditions exists. Listen for later forecasts and possible red flag warnings.
